choices: I'm with the Twatterati.
I'm part of the Rebellion.
I could go either way.
Right now, I'm just on the sidelines.
1.content:
The insanity begins on April 20, 2009. As people find each other on the internet, plots to push agendas and fight poser tyrants form. There are two sides: the Twatterati and the Rebellion. WHat side are you on?

The Twatterati are pseudohipsters that are addicted to the miccroblogging service. They have spent enough time Twittering to know how to use the program to brainwash people. All they need is time and a plan for what to do with those who are brainwashed. Once they have that, they are prepared to instill something of a New World Order. Little can be gleaned about them, except they're like cocaine: instantly addictive. Without getting close enough to become addicted, some sources say the leader of the Twatterati goes by the name Alp4aMe.

The Rebellion consists of people who are on the internet but have learned how to fly under the radar. They heard around about the Twatterati's dangerous plans and feel it must be stopped. People who choose to take on the Twatterati have a difficult job, as making the connections to the core group is time consuming if one doesn't know where to look. If one can contact the Rebellion's Leader, FuegoPura, it's only a tiny step in quashing the Twatterati.

The sides in this war are taking shape. Where do you stand in this frivolous battle?
1.title: Choose a Side

choices: I recruit more people to join the Twatterati through my various connections
I become a spy, infiltrating the Rebellion
I go on a mission to assasinate suspected leaders of the Rebellion
I do absolutely nothing.
I hatch a kickass plan of my own
11.content: O to the M to the G, I'm a blasted Twatterati. I am who I am and I am not ashamed. I'm the sort of person who enjoys nothing better than a good fanfiction- there's just something relaxing about having the character, setting, and plot taken care of already, leaving you to think up the absurd situation or ridiculously unlikely love triangle. While waiting for my favorite Twilight/Harry Potter crossover to be updated with another sexy, sweaty, drool-inducing chapter of Vampire Harry, I found myself craving something new, something fresh. I'm not sure exactly how I got sucked into Twitter, but within two seconds of creating an account, I was hooked. When I heard about the Rebellion setting out to damage the glorious mission of the Twatterati, I knew that I had to fight them, but how?
11.title: I'm with the Twatterati.

choices: Join Google-ers R Us
Find another way to be useful.
I'm a Twatterati infiltrator, Google must die!
Apathetically unsure about taking a side.
FuegoPura finds his correct IP address.
12.content:
I am a Google-er by nature. I've heard of the infamous Twatterati and their non-stop Twittering psychobable-ists. In my efforts to rid the world of their twitter-tapping little fingers, I have determined that if enough people are mislead to bad IP addresses that this movement can be stopped.

Of course, when I Googled FuegoPura all I got was the misleading paragraph on how to leave a message on Dailymotion, which is about finding new ways to see, share and engage your world through the power of online video. Upload your personal videos to share publicly, ...well, you get the picture.

So here I sit, unrecruited and apathetically google-ing till my fingers will type no more. How will it all end?
12.title: I'm part of the Rebellion-I think.

choices: Ailsa accompanies Gregor to dinner
Alisa declines but goes to next week's meeting to see if he's bluffing.
Alisa runs far, far away from this guy.
121.content:
Out of reasonable options yet with a shitload of time on my hands, I decided to sign up for Google-ers R Us. I saw ads for it in a few places but was surprised to find it was a physical group that met in my hometown. After filling out a contact page, I found a list of meeting times and places. The next meeting was only a couple days away. I figured I might as well go to that one.

We gathered at the Lyric Theater and sat on the main stage. Twenty or so chairs were placed in a semicircle facing out toward the seats. By the time I arrived, only two seats were empty. I snagged one near an end just as a borderline anorexic guy ran up on stage and stood in front of us. Looking around, it seemed a lot of people assembled knew this guy, as their faces relaxed or even turned into small smiles. Their reaction soothed my nerves, even though the lot of these people were overweight and looked like they hardly left their houses. I should have guessed given this was a group of people who lived at their computers. Then again, my slim figure and my biological sex (I'm a girl) made me look like one of those blasted Twatterati members.

The meeting was kind of dull, dominated by one guy's verbal dissertation on a Google hack that could be used to access streaming porn around particular firewalls. Just as I was about to fall asleep, Mr. Manorexic (as I started calling the group leader in my head) dismissed the meeting. As I got up to leave, a skinny but cute guy with a mop of reddish brown hair approached me.

"Ailsa, right?" he asked.

I nodded.

"Are you here looking for information on how to find FuegoPura?"

"How would you know that?"

The kid smiled. "That's my little secret."

Cocking my head, I told him to give it up without uttering a single word.

"Tell you what. I'll buy you dinner and tell you how I know."

Free food? I could swing that.

"Well..." I said, "maybe. But who are you, anyway?"

"The name's Gregor."

"Alright, Gregor...."
121.title: Join Google-ers R Us

choices: Gregor/Igor Tries Romancing the Stone
Ailsa Pours One On
Split at the Seams, Otherwise Known as the Jean Debacle
1211.content:
As Gregor and Ailsa stepped into the diner I could tell she was so not into him. I flipped open my camera phone and snapped his picture so I could use it later to correctly identify him.

Gregor worked for the other side, but he thought no one knew. In actuality he Igor McTweeter, one of the worst of the Twatterati in the state, but of course Ailsa wouldn't know that. That's why I'm here.

I've got her back, even if she didn't know it. The waitress seated them in a corner booth just across from me and as he slid in, I shot a small ice needle into his right butt cheek making him jump and bump his bony hips on the table.

By the time the waitress took their order, he had to excuse himself to use the restroom-they don't call that Ice needle shot the Volcano for nothing! As soon as he had the door closed behind him I approached Ailsa.

"You don't know me, but I know you're on the Google Team. Watch yourself, he's a double agent and one of the worst Twatterati in the state, he's probably Twatting right now while he's emptying his bowels! If you need any help, I'm right over at that table."
1211.title: Ailsa accompanies Gregor to dinner

choices: You realize you just gave away your strategy?
I have been brainwashed. xP
It's Ass-butt, not Google-butt, you Ass-butt
123.content:
The thing about Google, it's not as smart as you think it is. It can't be brainwashed (well, we're working on it), so it doesn't know you can be (well, the new version does, but who actually updates their Google?)

Side-note: Updating Google leads to Skynet. Join the anti-update movement. (Also, we have free cookies.)

It took a long time to Twitter-Brainwash a Google worker, y'know. They avoid us like the plague. But we have one now! We know the Source Code of Doom. Mwah-ha-

ha. Ha ha. xD Twitter FTW. Oh, yeah, and plan and stuff. See, we can change the code to put our most brainwashy twitters to the top of Google's search - so you'll all see them every time you search 'Twitter'! You'll all be brainwashed! Mwah-ha-

ha. ROFLMAO!!!!1!

Your move, Google-butt. B-P

Uh... does anyone on our side actually know how to re-program source code...?
123.title: I'm a Twatterati infiltrator, Google must die!

choices: Get a message to warn to Twatteratti!
Have a snack while you rewrite coding for all over the twatterverse! (MUAHAHAH!)
I'll be over here just never choosing a cause.
125.content:
Finally able to relax and laugh maniacally, FuegoPura muses over the events that lead to the only operable IP address capable of uploading to the information super-highway being all his!

Setting out to dump all of the video-media files out of the rain cloud storage, he giggled. "home made POV cam from my orgasmo reenactment project, 'freaky, fake, fetishes' project" , they were all gold mines and all his. Surely, the Rebellion would see that he was on no one's side, only his own. Then, of course, they would have to bow to his irritating power of upload-able powers!

Now, all that was left was planning the dismantling and destruction of the Twatterverse and it's infamous Twatterati, the last indigenous creatures of the Twatterverse! It's just a good thing that FuegoPura remembered to download that Coding and Scripting APP today, he would need all of the help he could find making the twatterverse disappear forever!
125.title: FuegoPura finds his correct IP address.

choices: He arrives to find his classmates talking about the Twitter story.
Once in class, he finds someone in the room Twittering.
On a whim, he skips class and heads off to one of the computer labs.
14.content:
I don't care what Dante says. High school is the Ninth Circle of Hell. As I sit here nibbling at something that vaguely resembles a slice of pizza, I try to ignore the din of people texting each other and jabbering about their blogs. I might be a 16 year old guy, but I really do not see the appeal of chattering about your clothes or showing off pictures of your drunken shenanigans on the internet. If it wasn't illegal and immoral, I'd hit of those vapid, popular bitches that I know blabs about her personal shit all the time. It's ridiculous.

Realizing that this chatter was hindering my appetite more than anything, I tossed my lunch in the trash and headed out the door. I still had about fifteen minutes until my next class, so I wandered the courtyard wondering what to do with my time, seeing that I had next to no appetite. Not wanting to look at my mostly complete Spanish homework, I grabbed a copy of the school newspaper. There wasn't too much interesting being written, but I was so bored I started reading an article on Twitter. Apparently the reporter caught wind of some sort of battle between militant Twitters and some small group on the internet calling themselves the Rebellion. Rebellion? Seriously? Haven't these people heard the joke about fighting on the internet and how it's like the Special Olympics? Hell, even President Obama knows the score on that one. I just hope he doesn't Twitter on his Blackberry or any of that shit.

By the time the bell rang, I had read the paper from cover to cover, which still didn't get the stupid story about Twitter and the Rebellion out of my head. Sighing, I trudged to my locker to grab a couple books. Time for Calculus. Maybe that will get this story out of my head.
14.title: Right now, I'm just on the sidelines.

choices: He greets David and enquires about the latest "tweets" in the headlines
He determines to investigate this phenomenon for himself after school
He storms out of the class and sulks in the library
142.content:
Three weeks from the exams, our teacher had been replaced by a nervous bird-like man who chirpped and squawked mostly to himself and the blackboard. Like a pigeon with no where to go he tottered up and down trying to avoid any contact with a student. The class returned the favour and ignored him entirely. As I walked in the room well after the last bell, no-one even noticed. The class had segregated itself by blatant and unchangeable rules of social groupings.

Poor Leonnard, the teacher's pet, was drifting without purpose now that there was no-one to dote on him and no homework to bury his fears in. He wandered through the text book trying desperately to find some piece of knowledge to hold onto so he wouldn't get sucked into the vortex of uselessness that is puberty. The jocks stood over the cheerleaders who were poised to look non-chalant as they sat updating their facebook statuses. I suddenly had an image of instinct driven male primates dueling over a mate and laughed to myself; what could she possibly be writing? "Crotch in my face, what's new?" The gaming nerds sat in a clump at the back or the room. This group is easy to identify; they look greasy, red-eyed and like they haven't changed their cloths in a week, they are smelly, oily and uninterested in reality. The group heaved and jolted, reliving their great adventures as gnomes and trolls in grunts and snorts.

The only seat open was next to the high tech snobs group. These are the people who will one day design Schwartzeneggars "Terminator" robots that will take over the world. They are crisp and slick, always wearing black and never bothering with spoken word. Their eyes dart back and forth across a screen as their fingers nimbly take hold of the keys. Why speak when a machine can do it for you?

I sit in the open seat next to David, a Korean exchange student who openly laughs at our education system. His eyes flicker back and forth as his fingers dance on the touchscreen. I glanced at the brand new tech and flinched as the home page of his twitter account gleamed back at me. Can a person not escape this beast that consumes our devotion? I would just like to have a normal conversation for a change, is that even allowed these days?
142.title: Once in class, he finds someone in the room Twi...

info.brief_description: Wreaking havoc in 140 characters or less
info.description:
As technology changes, the way people get things done also changes. As hipster wannabes and businesses alike jump on the Twitter bandwagon, the only question that lingers is Is there any limit to Twitter's potential? This interactive probably won't answer that, but it will provide you with an amusing opportunity to try.

The basic premise of this interactive is a small group of Twitter fanatics plotting to take over the world we know using the microblogging service and the people who reject their plans for whatever reason (genuine concern about these plans, hating Twitter, having nothing better to do, etc.). It is an intentionally bad interactive story. So get silly. Get nonsensical. Make this faceoff as absurd as you want! There are just a couple rules before you decide to dive in.

Keep lolspeak and other internet cliches to a reasonable level (e.g. Twitter posts, other online forms of communication). In the story itself, do make an effort to use good grammar.

Any chapters containing any of the following will be deleted because they, quite frankly, are annoying and have nothing to do with a story set in the real world.

shrinking/growth
vore
animal pornography
fantasy fanfiction (Harry Potter, Lord of the Rings, Twilight and so on)
absurd weight gain
anything that comes up when you turn off the topic fliter


That said, the rating limit is GC. That means bad language, violence, sexual content and mature themes are allowed. Just be funny about it, because that's what counts.

If you are enjoying this interactive, PLEASE RATE IT ONE STAR!!!! Since it is an intentionally bad item, rate it as such.

With all that out of the way, are you ready for the most convoluted world takeover event EVER? If so, come on in!
